item.title: Vlan Configuration in Cisco Switches
item.description: Overview On Cisco switches, VLAN configuration is primarily performed at Layer 2 (switching) using VLAN databases and per-port VLAN assignment. Layer 3 VLAN routing is performed using SVI (Switched Virtual Interface) on Layer 3 switches or routers. Cisco separates VLAN configuration into two main components: Switchport VLAN Configuration (Layer 2) SVI – Switched Virtual Interface (Layer 3) Switchport VLAN (Layer 2 VLAN Switching) Description Switchport VLAN configuration defines: Which VLAN a port belongs to

item.title: Vlan Configuration in Mikrotik Interface Vlan vs Bridge Vlan
item.description: Overview MikroTik supports VLAN implementation at both Layer 2 (Switching) and Layer 3 (Routing). Correctly distinguishing Interface VLAN and Bridge VLAN is essential for proper network segmentation, routing, and management. Interface VLAN (L3 VLAN Interface) Description An Interface VLAN is a logical Layer 3 interface created on top of a physical interface or bridge. It is used to assign IP addresses and route traffic for a specific VLAN. Purpose Provide IP addressing to VLANs
